Article Title: Dad gets death as girl, 13, testifies he killed wife & son
Article Text:
Representative photo

AGRA: Ex-Army jawan Manoj Kumar , 50, was sentenced to death by a court in Aligarh on Saturday for the murder of his wife Seema Devi , 38, son Manvendra Singh , 6, and neighbour Shashibala, 40, in 2014. The court relied heavily on the testimony of the convict’s 13-year-old daughter, Usimita Singh, who was critically injured in the incident, ADGC Mape Singh said.On July 12 that year, after a verbal spat with his wife, Manoj, in a fit of rage, took out a rifle and a revolver from his cupboard and shot her in the chest. Hearing gunshots, their neighbour Shashibala rushed in and the ex-Army jawan shot her in the head. Manoj then targeted his children. Manvendra, terrified by the gunshots clung on to his legs, pleading to spare his life, but he was also shot in the head. All three died. His daughter, a student of Class 8, was shot in the face but survived to narrate the horrific details before the court.Manoj was overpowered by neighbours and handed over to the police, and Seema’s brother Dilip Kumar later filed a complaint at Banna Devi in Aligarh.In his police complaint, Dilip stated that he was about to visit his sister’s place when he noticed a lot of commotion on the road. Soon, he came to know that Manoj had “attacked several people”. When he stepped into the house, Dilip saw his brother-in-law shooting at the 13-year-old girl. He further stated that Manoj was ill-tempered and used to often beat his wife and children. Police registered a case against the ex-Army man under IPC sections 302 (murder) and 307 (attempt to murder).
Article Summary: Manoj Kumar was sentenced to death by a court in Aligarh for the murder of his wife Seema Devi, 38, son Manvendra Singh, 6, and neighbour Shashibala, 40, in 2014. The court relied heavily on the testimony of the convict’s 13-year-old daughter, Usimita Singh, who was critically injured in the incident.

Article Title: Fadnavis first Maha CM to become guardian minister
Article Text:
Photo: Agency

MUMBAI: Over a month after ministers took oath, the Maharashtra govt on Saturday announced guardian ministers for all 36 districts across the state. Chief minister Devendra Fadnavis was named the guardian minister of the naxal-affected Gadchiroli , becoming the first CM to be appointed a guardian minister. Sena’s Ashish Jaiswal will be the joint guardian minister for Gadchiroli.Deputy CM Eknath Shinde will be the guardian minister for Mumbai City and the Shiv Sena bastion of Thane, while deputy CM Ajit Pawar will be the guardian minister for Beed and Pune. BJP’s Ashish Shelar will be the guardian minister for Suburban Mumbai, while Mangal Prabhat Lodha has been appointed as joint guardian minister. BJP’s Chandrashekhar Bawankule is the guardian minister for Nagpur and Amravati.Political observers said it was the first time the state govt appointed joint guardian ministers, especially when there are 42 ministers in the state council of ministers. NCP’s Dhananjay Munde, who is under fire over the killing of sarpanch Santosh Deshmukh in Beed, has not been made guardian minister. His cousin, BJP’s Pankaja Munde, is the guardian minister for Jalna district.Shinde’s appointment as guardian minister of Thane and Mumbai City is seen as a bid to take on Shiv Sena (UBT) ahead of the BMC polls, especially after it received a drubbing in the state assembly polls.In Kolhapur, Sena’s Prakash Abitkar will be the guardian minister, while BJP’s Madhuri Misal will be the joint guardian minister.Guardian ministers control the District Planning and Development Council (DPDC) funds, which are used for development and beautification projects. They also preside over events like Independence Day and Republic Day.Sena’s Uday Samant is the guardian minister for Ratnagiri, while BJP’s Nitesh Rane is the guardian minister for Sindhudurg. In a setback for Sena’s Bharat Gogawale, NCP’s Aditi Tatkare will be the guardian minister for Raigad district. This post was claimed by Gogawale. Sena’s Sanjay Shirsat is the guardian minister for Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar. Apart from Sena’s Gogawale, Sena minister Dada Bhuse too has not been made guardian minister.In a setback for NCP, BJP’s Girish Mahajan will be the guardian minister for Nashik. NCP’s Manikrao Kokate had claimed this post. Kokate will be the guardian minister for Nandurbar. BJP’s Jaykumar Rawal will be the guardian minister for Dhule. BJP’s Ganesh Naik will be the guardian minister for Palghar. Sena’s Sambhuraje Desai is the guardian minister for Satara.
Article Summary: Chief minister Devendra Fadnavis named the guardian minister of the naxal- affected Gadchiroli. Deputy CM Eknath Shinde will be guardian minister for Mumbai City and Thane. NCP’s Dhananjay Munde, who is under fire over the killing of sarpanch Santosh Deshmukh in Beed, has not been made guardian minister.

The capital is set for a triangular electoral battle involving the incumbent Aam Aadmi Party, the BJP, and the Congress.The BJP announced its initial list of 29 candidates on January 4, 2025.
Article Summary: The BJP announced its initial list of 29 candidates on January 4, 2025. Delhi will go to polls on February 5, and the results will be declared on February 8. The capital is set for a triangular electoral battle involving the incumbent Aam Aadmi Party, the BJP and the Congress.

Article Title: What youth hit by Arvind Kejriwal's car claim, and AAP's response
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Arvind Kejriwal signalled the driver to hit us, said the victims who got injured after being allegedly hit by former chief minister's car. The three injured said that they wanted to talk to the AAP chief about jobs when the incident occurred."I am a resident of the (New Delhi) constituency. We just went there to ask him about jobs. Arvind Kejriwal signalled the driver of the car to hit us," said Vishal, one of the injured."He (Arvind Kejriwal) signalled the driver to hit us. I have been injured. Three people have been injured...I am a voter of this (New Delhi) constituency," said another injured Rohit.Bharatiya Janata Party leader Parvesh Verma met with the victims at the Lady Hardinge Medical College. Verma is a candidate from the New Delhi constituency for the upcoming Delhi polls. Further, the injured youth are voters from the same constituency.This came after AAP accused Parvesh Verma's goons of attacking Kejriwal's car with stones. Terming the allegations "baseless", Verma said that the three youths had attempted to ask the ex-CM about jobs when they were harassed by Punjab police and hit by his car."Punjab Police beat them up, broke a worker's phone, and Kejriwal’s car hit the three youths. The driver applied brakes, but Kejriwal signaled the driver to crush them. This is an attempt to murder," he said.Meanwhile, AAP spokesperson Priyanka Kakkar criticised the Election Commission for keeping their "eyes shut" and called for an immediate action into the matter."Today again BJP goons attacked Arvind Kejriwal, who was campaigning in New Delhi Vidhan Sabha, with stones. When Parvesh Verma was campaigning on the ground there, he was stunned to see that even after distributing so much money and doing all the black deeds, the public is with Arvind Kejriwal. This attack is extremely condemnable. The Election Commission does not want a peaceful election to take place in the New Delhi Assembly. Its eyes are shut... Immediate action should be taken on this. I hope the eyes of the Election Commission and the Delhi Police will open," she said.Authorities have yet to confirm the specifics of the incident. As campaigning heats up for the New Delhi assembly seat, the incident has further heightened tensions, fueling clashes between both parties over the allegations.
Article Summary: Arvind Kejriwal signalled the driver to hit us, said the victims who got injured after being allegedly hit by former chief minister's car. The three injured said that they wanted to talk to the AAP chief about jobs when the incident occurred. Parvesh Verma is a candidate from the New Delhi constituency.

Article Title: Court finds Himachal IG, 7 others guilty in custodial death case
Article Text:
Representative photo

Zaidi led team that made arrests

CHANDIGARH: A special CBI court in Chandigarh on Saturday convicted Himachal Pradesh inspector general Zahur Haider Zaidi and seven other cops in the Kotkhai custodial death case while acquitting then SP Dandu Wangyal Negi due to lack of evidence. The court will pronounce the quantum of punishment on Jan 27.The other convicted policemen are DSP Manoj Joshi; Rajinder Singh, then SHO of Kotkhai police station; ASI Deep Chand Sharma; head constable Mohan Lal; head constable Surat Singh; head constable Rafi Mohammad and constable Ranjit Sateta.All the convicts were taken into judicial custody after the verdict and will be presented in court at 10am on the day of the sentencing. The case pertains to the death of Suraj, an accused in the gang rape and murder of a 16-year-old girl in 2017, in police custody. In May 2019, Supreme Court had transferred the case from a Himachal court to Chandigarh CBI court.The guilty were convicted under IPC Sections 120B (criminal conspiracy), 302 (murder), 330 (causing hurt to extort confession), 348 (wrongful confinement), 195 (fabricating false evidence), 196 (using false evidence), 218 (tampering with documents), and 201 (destruction of evidence).In the case, the body of a Class 10 student was found in a forest in Kotkhai, Shimla , on July 4, 2017, two days after she went missing. A special investigation team led by IG Zaidi arrested six suspects, including Suraj.
Article Summary: Zahur Haider Zaidi and seven other cops convicted in Kotkhai custodial death case. The court will pronounce the quantum of punishment on Jan 27. The case pertains to the death of Suraj, an accused in the gang rape and murder of a 16-year-old girl in 2017.

Article Title: Arvind Kejriwal's car attacked by BJP workers, says AAP; Parvesh Verma makes big counterclaim
Article Text:
BJP candidate from the New Delhi assembly seat, Parvesh Verma, accused Kejriwal and his team of violence and misconduct.

Poll What Do You Think Is the Most Important Aspect of Ensuring Safe Political Campaigns? Promoting Peaceful Campaigning Practices Strict Security Measures for Campaign Events

AAP alleges attack on Kejriwal’s convoy during campaign

Priyanka Kakkar calls for Election Commission action

Parvesh Verma counters with 'baseless allegations' remark

Verma alleges Kejriwal’s convoy injured three locals

BJP spokesperson brands AAP as 'Anarchist Apradhi Party'

BJP MP Bansuri Swaraj slams Kejriwal over alleged car incident

AAP MP Sanjay Singh accuses BJP of hooliganism

Congress reacts amid escalating tensions

NEW DELHI: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Saturday claimed that former Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal was attacked during his campaign in the New Delhi constituency. The incident has sparked a political war of words between the AAP and the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP).AAP shared a video on social media alleging that BJP candidate Parvesh Verma ’s supporters attacked Kejriwal's convoy with bricks and stones. The party claimed that the attackers attempted to injure Kejriwal to hinder his campaigning efforts. The accompanying post said in Hindi, "BJP people, Kejriwal ji is not going to be scared of your cowardly attack, the people of Delhi will give you a befitting reply."Addressing the incident, AAP national spokesperson Priyanka Kakkar said, "Today again BJP goons attacked Arvind Kejriwal, who was campaigning in New Delhi Vidhan Sabha, with stones. When Parvesh Verma was campaigning on the ground there, he was stunned to see that even after distributing so much money and doing all the black deeds, the public is with Arvind Kejriwal. This attack is extremely condemnable. The Election Commission does not want a peaceful election to take place in the New Delhi Assembly. Its eyes are shut... Immediate action should be taken on this. I hope the eyes of the Election Commission and the Delhi Police will open."In response, the BJP candidate from the New Delhi assembly seat , Parvesh Verma, accused Kejriwal and his team of violence and misconduct. He said, "All the allegations of AAP National Convenor Arvind Kejriwal are baseless."He further alleged that during Kejriwal's door-to-door campaign near Lal Bahadur Sadan, three unemployed youths—Vishal, Abhishek, and Rohit—attempted to question Kejriwal about issues like employment. According to Verma, "Punjab Police beat them up, broke a worker's phone, and Kejriwal’s car hit the three youths. The driver applied brakes, but Kejriwal signaled the driver to crush them. This is an attempt to murder."Verma claimed the three youths were injured. Speaking to reporters, he said, "The car of Arvind Kejriwal has gone ahead by crushing the worker of the BJP. The leg of the worker has broken, and I am going to the Lady Hardinge Medical College to inquire about his health. This is very shameful." He added, "A case of attempt to murder will also be registered."Verma further said, "All the three injured are residents of this assembly constituency, and they were hit by the car of AAP National Convenor Arvind Kejriwal. Arvind Kejriwal is afraid of his defeat."BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla, meanwhile, launched a scathing attack on AAP, branding it the "Anarchist Apradhi Party." Poonawalla accused AAP of fabricating incidents to gain sympathy and divert attention from their failures. "The way Arvind Kejriwal drove his car over three youths shows his mindset and the desperation within AAP. This incident is nothing but a 'sponsored attack' staged by AAP to play the victim card. It’s an old habit of theirs—they create drama to avoid answering real questions from the people. Instead of addressing unemployment and governance failures, they resort to theatrics and violence," he said.Poonawalla further claimed that the incident highlights AAP’s disregard for the rule of law. "This is the same party that thrives on anarchy. When cornered by public scrutiny, they orchestrate such events to shift the narrative. The truth is that AAP has no answers for their broken promises, and now they’re trying to pin the blame on us. The people of Delhi are watching, and they will respond through the ballot box," he added.BJP MP Bansuri Swaraj, after meeting the three youths allegedly injured by the car of Kejriwal, launched a scathing attack on the Delhi Chief Minister. The incident has intensified the war of words between the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) and the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) amid the ongoing New Delhi assembly campaign.Swaraj claimed that the injured individuals, now undergoing treatment, were seen in wheelchairs. "AAP's National Convenor Arvind Kejriwal hit them with his car with ruthlessness and cruelty. This is an example of petty politics and shows he is afraid of his defeat," she said.The BJP MP accused Kejriwal of avoiding accountability and failing to fulfill his promises. She questioned the credibility of his claims of feeling threatened by three youths, given his constant security provided by the Punjab Police. "How can the VVIP who is always guarded by Punjab Police get frightened by three youths?" Swaraj asked.Highlighting the gravity of the incident, Swaraj added, "The party will take whatever criminal action needs to be taken."In retaliation, AAP MP Sanjay Singh alleged that BJP wanted to win the elections through hooliganism.Speaking to the media, Singh said, "They are attacking Arvind Kejriwal with stones. Parvesh Verma's people attacked him with stones. You want to win the elections by hooliganism. The workers and leaders of the Aam Aadmi Party have never bowed down before you. Why do they do such cowardly acts? What will they achieve by this? BJP is a party of cowards, and I strongly condemn it."Congress candidate from the New Delhi Assembly, Sandeep Dikshit, also condemned the incident but criticized both AAP and BJP for not addressing core public concerns. "We condemn this; violence has no place in democracy. I hope the police will investigate, and only then will it be known what kind of attack it was. Violence should not happen. I hope the police will provide Kejriwal with more security. However, both parties (AAP and BJP) do not talk about the real issues,"Authorities have not yet verified the details of the incident. With campaigning intensifying for the New Delhi assembly seat, the incident has added to the charged atmosphere as both parties spar over the accusations.
Article Summary: BJP candidate from the New Delhi assembly seat, Parvesh Verma, accused Kejriwal and his team of violence and misconduct. The incident has sparked a political war of words between the AAP and the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) claimed that former Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal was attacked during his campaign.

Article Title: Woman tourist, instructor killed in paragliding accident in Goa
Article Text:
‘Offence registered against owner of company’

PANAJI: A woman tourist from Maharashtra and a paraglider operator from Nepal lost their lives after the rope snapped while they were paragliding at Keri plateau on Saturday evening. Goa police booked the owner of the paragliding company for alleged culpable homicide.The incident took place between 4.30pm and 5pm, police said. Police identified the deceased as 27-year-old Pune resident Shivani Dabale and 26-year-old operator Suman Nepali .Police said that Dabale came to Goa with a friend. Police said that the paraglider took off from Keri plateau along with the tourist and was flying at a low altitude.Police said that one of the ropes of the paraglider snapped, and they hit different rocks. The deceased suffered fractures and later succumbed to injuries.Police said an ambulance was immediately called, and both were shifted to the Goa Medical College (GMC), where they were declared brought dead. The bodies have been preserved in the morgue and the autopsies will be conducted on Sunday.Mandrem MLA Jit Arolkar said that he has written to the tourism department to stop paragliding activities at Keri plateau as it is a dangerous area. He said that even the Keri panchayat had taken a resolution to stop paragliding activities. Arolkar said that there are four paragliding operators on the plateau.An offence has been registered at Mandrem police station against Shekhar Raizada, owner of Hike ‘n’ Fly Company, who, without obtaining permission from the appropriate authority, knowingly allowed his paraglider pilot to conduct the paragliding activities with the tourist,” superintendent of police (SP) Tikam Singh Verma said.Verma said that with the knowledge that his act could endanger human life and in order to earn, Raizada intentionally permitted Dabale and Nepali, without a valid licence, to carry out the paragliding from the height, resulting in the their deaths.Mandrem police registered the case under Section 105 BNS (culpable homicide that is not considered murder), Verma said.
Article Summary: A woman tourist from Maharashtra and a paraglider operator from Nepal lost their lives after the rope snapped. The incident took place between 4.30pm and 5pm, police said. Goa police booked the owner of the paragLiding company for alleged culpable homicide.

Article Title: Bangladesh: Reform panel recommends two-term limit on PM's tenure
Article Text: In a report submitted to the Muhammad Yunus-led interim govt Wednesday, the Constitution Reform Commission has recommended introducing a two-term limit on the PM's tenure. It also proposed reinstating the provision for a referendum to amend the constitution and introducing a bicameral parliament - a lower house (national assembly) and upper house (senate) - to ensure representation for all.Both houses will have terms of four years, meaning govt's and the PM's term will also be four years, the commission has suggested. It has recommended reforms to ensure that the PM can face a no-confidence motion in parliament.To prevent the concentration of power in the hands of an individual or institution, it has proposed the creation of a constitutional body - national constitutional council (NCC) - to establish a system of checks and balances between the three branches of the state and the two executive positions - PM and president.This council would include the president, chief justice, PM, leaders of opposition of both houses, speakers and deputy speakers from the opposition, and a representative of other parties. The commission has recommended decentralising the judiciary by maintaining the unitary structure of Supreme Court, while establishing permanent high court benches with jurisdiction in all divisional cities.It has also provided a framework for an interim govt to be formed after the dissolution of parliament, and recommended that selection of advisers to such govts should be solely the NCC's responsibility.
Article Summary: The Constitution Reform Commission has recommended introducing a two-term limit on the PM's tenure. It has also proposed reinstating the provision for a referendum to amend the constitution. The commission has recommended decentralising the judiciary by maintaining the unitary structure of Supreme Court.

Article Title: Bangladesh SC acquits Khaleda Zia in corruption case, allowing her to contest elections
Article Text: Bangladesh Nationalist Party chairperson Khaleda Zia , her son and BNP acting chairman Tarique Rahman , along with four other accused, were acquitted on Wednesday by the appellate division of Bangladesh Supreme Court in the Zia Orphanage Trust corruption case . They had previously been sentenced to 10 years' imprisonment in the case, which SC termed "malicious".Following the verdict, there are now no legal barriers preventing the two-time former PM from contesting the upcoming national elections. Khaleda and her son are currently residing in London.SC overturned the judgments delivered during the regime of ousted PM Sheikh Hasina by the high court and trial court. The trial court had sentenced Khaleda to five years' imprisonment, while Tarique and the other accused received 10 years each. Later, HC doubled Khaleda's sentence to 10 years while upholding trial court's verdict for the other accused.In its ruling, SC observed that the prosecution of the Zia Orphanage Trust case was "malicious" and noted that the accused, who did not appeal the HC verdict, would also benefit from this judgment "restoring their dignity as innocent individuals".A five-member bench of the appellate division, led by Chief Justice Syed Refaat Ahmed, delivered the unanimous verdict. The ruling came after hearings on two appeals filed by Khaleda and individual appeals made by Kazi Kamal and businessman Sharafuddin Ahmed. Khaleda had initially been jailed on Feb 8, 2018 after a special court in Dhaka sentenced her to five years in prison for her involvement in the case. The other accused - Kazi Kamal, Sharafuddin, Kamal Uddin Siddique and Mominur Rahman - were sentenced to 10 years' imprisonment for misappropriating over BDT 2.1 crore, which was intended as foreign grants for orphans.
Article Summary: Khaleda Zia, her son and BNP acting chairman Tarique Rahman were acquitted on Wednesday by the appellate division of Bangladesh Supreme Court. They had previously been sentenced to 10 years' imprisonment in the case, which SC termed "malicious" There are now no legal barriers preventing the two-time former PM from contesting the upcoming national elections.
